function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) and robots for surveillance and enforcement of lockdown policies may lead to privacy concerns and violations.","Impact":"Public backlash, erosion of trust, and potential legal consequences.","Mitigation":"Implement strict regulations and guidelines for data collection and usage, ensure transparency and accountability in the use of surveillance technology, and provide clear mechanisms for redress.","Technologies":"Encryption, anonymization, and data access controls","People":"Residents, individuals under surveillance, and the general public","Owner":"Government authorities, regulatory bodies, and technology developers"},{"Description":"Close contact and potential transmission of the virus may occur during the enforcement of lockdown policies by unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) and robots.","Impact":"Increased risk of virus transmission, potential health consequences, and public resistance to enforcement measures.","Mitigation":"Implement safety protocols for the operation of UAVs and robots, ensure proper communication with individuals under surveillance, and provide education on the purpose and importance of enforcement measures.","Technologies":"Remote communication tools, real-time monitoring sensors, and hazard detection systems","People":"Residents, individuals under surveillance, and enforcement personnel","Owner":"Health authorities, local government, and enforcement agencies"},{"Description":"Large-scale data transmission and analysis through the 5G network may pose cybersecurity risks and vulnerabilities.","Impact":"Potential data breaches, unauthorized access to sensitive information, and disruption of surveillance operations.","Mitigation":"Implement robust encryption protocols, stringent access controls, and continuous monitoring for potential cyber threats. Regular security audits and updates are also essential.","Technologies":"End-to-end encryption, secure network protocols, and threat detection systems","People":"Government authorities, technology developers, and cybersecurity experts","Owner":"Government agencies, network operators, and cybersecurity organizations"}]}
